intro: Cheilanthes krameri, commonly known as the desert spikemoss, is a species of fern that thrives in arid environments. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing structure and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has thick, leathery leaves that help it retain moisture in dry conditions. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Cheilanthes krameri is adapted to survive in harsh climates, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
